seo.description: Complete guide to Cinque Terre hiking trails. Trail maps, difficulty levels, access fees, best times to hike, and tips for the famous Blue Trail connecting all five villages.

body.title: Hiking in Cinque Terre
body.subtitle: World-famous trails connecting five UNESCO villages along Italy's stunning Ligurian coast. From easy walks to challenging climbs, discover breathtaking Mediterranean views at every turn.

body.title: Cinque Terre Trails by the Numbers
Must-Do Hiking Trails
body.subtitle: From the famous coastal path to mountain sanctuaries, these are the trails that define Cinque Terre.

features.title: Blue Trail (Sentiero Azzurro)
features.description: The classic coastal path connecting all five villages. 12km total, can be hiked in sections or completed in one challenging day.

features.title: Via dell'Amore
features.description: The romantic 'Path of Love' between Riomaggiore and Manarola. Partially reopening after years of repairs.

features.title: Monterosso to Vernazza
features.description: The most challenging Blue Trail section with steep climbs rewarded by spectacular panoramic views.

features.title: Sanctuary Trails
features.description: Ancient pilgrim paths climbing to hilltop sanctuaries with panoramic views over all five villages.

features.title: Vineyard Walks
features.description: Wander through terraced vineyards producing Cinque Terre DOC wines and famous Sciacchetrà.

features.title: Sunrise Hikes
features.description: Early morning trails to catch golden hour light over the Mediterranean with minimal crowds.

body.title: The Cinque Terre Card
body.subtitle: Required for hiking the main trails.
body.content: The **Cinque Terre Card** (€7.50/day) is required to access the Blue Trail and most hiking paths. It includes unlimited regional train travel between villages and access to all park facilities. Available at all train stations and park offices. The Trekking Card (hiking only, no train) costs €7.50. Multi-day options offer better value for extended stays.

items.question: What's the best trail for beginners?
items.answer: Start with the Vernazza to Corniglia section - moderate difficulty with incredible views. Or try the easy walk from Manarola to Corniglia when the lower path is open.

items.question: When is the best time to hike?
items.answer: April-May and September-October offer ideal weather and fewer crowds. Avoid July-August midday heat. Early morning or late afternoon are best for photos.

items.question: Are the trails difficult?
items.answer: Difficulty varies. The Blue Trail ranges from moderate to challenging with many steps. Wear sturdy shoes, bring water, and check trail conditions before starting.

items.question: Which trails are currently open?
items.answer: Trail conditions change frequently due to weather and repairs. Check the official park website or info offices for current status before planning your hike.

items.question: Can I hike in one day?
items.answer: Yes, the entire Blue Trail takes 5-7 hours for experienced hikers. Most visitors do 2-3 sections. Each section takes 1-2 hours.

items.question: What should I bring?
items.answer: Sturdy hiking shoes, water (1-2L), sunscreen, hat, camera, and snacks. Trekking poles helpful for steep sections. No flip-flops!
